events.originalText: After a five day search, the body of American actress and singer Naya Rivera is recovered from Lake Piru, confirming her death.
events.subtitle: Naya Rivera
events.headline: American actress Naya Rivera's body recovered from Lake Piru after five day search

events.originalText: Typhoon Soulik makes landfall in East China and Taiwan, killing at least 20 people.
events.subtitle: Typhoon Soulik (2013)
events.headline: Typhoon Soulik kills at least 20 in East China and Taiwan

events.originalText: French Directorate-General for External Security personnel aborted an operation to rescue Colombian politician Íngrid Betancourt from FARC guerrillas, resulting in a political scandal.
events.subtitle: Directorate-General for External Security
events.headline: French personnel abort rescue operation for Colombian politician Ingrid Betancourt

events.originalText: The Croatian Army concludes Operation Tiger, advancing 17 kilometres (11 miles) into the Dubrovnik hinterland.
events.subtitle: Croatian Army
events.headline: Croatian Army concludes Operation Tiger, advances 17 kilometres into Dubrovnik hinterland

events.originalText: Watergate scandal: Under questioning by Senate investigators, White House deputy chief of staff Alexander Butterfield revealed the existence of a secret taping system (tape recorder pictured) in the Oval Office.
events.subtitle: Watergate scandal
events.headline: White House deputy chief of staff reveals secret taping system in Oval Office under Watergate scandal

events.originalText: In an unprecedented reshuffle, British prime minister Harold Macmillan dismissed seven members of his Cabinet.
events.subtitle: Cabinet reshuffle
events.headline: British prime minister Harold Macmillan dismisses seven Cabinet members in reshuffle

events.originalText: World War II: Operation Fustian, an Allied operation to capture the Primosole Bridge in Sicily, begins.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Allied Operation Fustian to capture Primosole Bridge in Sicily begins in World War II

events.originalText: World War II: The 1st Filipino Infantry Regiment was converted from a battalion to accommodate a larger number of volunteers spurred on by the Japanese invasion of the Philippines.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: 1st Filipino Infantry Regiment converted to accommodate more volunteers in World War II

events.originalText: While on a campaign in Bulgaria, the Romanian Army suffered a cholera outbreak that led to around 1,600 deaths.
events.subtitle: Second Balkan War
events.headline: Romanian Army suffers cholera outbreak in Bulgaria campaign, leading to 1,600 deaths

events.originalText: Four days of rioting began in New York City in response to laws passed by the U.S. Congress to draft men to fight in the American Civil War.
events.subtitle: New York City draft riots
events.headline: Four days of rioting in New York City in response to draft laws for American Civil War

events.originalText: Wallachian officials adopted the Regulamentul Organic (cover shown), which engendered a period of unprecedented reforms that provided for the westernization of the local society.
events.subtitle: Wallachia
events.headline: Wallachian officials adopt Regulamentul Organic, sparking period of reforms

events.originalText: English Civil War: Royalist forces defeated the Parliamentarians at the Battle of Roundway Down near Devizes, Wiltshire.
events.subtitle: English Civil War
events.headline: Royalist forces defeat Parliamentarians at Battle of Roundway Down in English Civil War

events.originalText: Anglo–Spanish War: A convoy of English ships from the Levant Company repel a fleet of Spanish and Maltese galleys off the Mediterranean island of Pantelleria at the Battle of Pantelleria.
events.subtitle: Anglo-Spanish War (1585–1604)
events.headline: English ships repel Spanish and Maltese galleys at Battle of Pantelleria in Anglo-Spanish War

events.originalText: Livonian Crusade: Samogitian forces defeated Teutonic knights and the Livonian Order at the Battle of Durbe.
events.subtitle: Livonian Crusade
events.headline: Samogitian forces defeat Teutonic knights at Battle of Durbe in Livonian Crusade
